newsitem.title: BELGIUM: BELGIAN BONDS RALLY ENDS - FOR NOW.
newsitem.headline: BELGIAN BONDS RALLY ENDS - FOR NOW.

text.p: Belgian linear bonds slipped in line with Bunds on Wednesday to end a six-day bull run, but a consolidation phase in upcoming sessions can not hide that further price rises are in the works, dealers said.
The benchmark 2006 OLO closed with a yield of 5.77 percent against 5.72 percent on Tuesday. Bunds were affected by technicals and strong German third-quarter GDP data.
"Today was a bit of an off-day but price levels stay high and the undertone is still very positive," one trader said.
Others said the market was still well-bid and that the correction was necessary.
Traders noted that apart from professional business, some end investors were also in the market, but merely to extend the duration of their portfolio.

One said he believed profittaking would remain strictly limited as most investors would wait for next year to cash in on sharply higher prices. "Everybody has been served, so people will wait for next year," one said.
Another said that the benchmark yield could still slip further to 5.65 percent in upcoming weeks.
Traders expected the 10-year yield premium over Bunds to remain stable around the current level of 11 basis points.
One trader said that the low volume at Tuesday's exchange auction -- just 300 million francs compared to about 20 billion at previous auctions -- had helped keep the spread low.
